Package ch.epfl.biop.atlas.aligner

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MultiSlicePositioner.MultiSlicePositionerListener  
    MultiSlicePositioner.SliceChangeListener  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ABBAHelper  
    ABBAHelper.ABBASettings  
    CancelableAction
    Backbone of a cancelable action used for Bdv Slice Positioner This is used in order to: - store the sequence of actions (- for cancellation) - executes actions asynchronously (- for long computations) - keep track of which action is executed on which SliceSources - serialization Convention : an action acts on a single SliceSources object.
    CreateSliceAction
    Creates a new Slice source
    DebugView  
    DeformationFieldToImagePlus  
    DeleteLastRegistrationAction  
    DeleteSliceAction  
    EditLastRegistrationAction  
    LockAndRunOnceSliceAction
    Moves a slice to a new position along the slicing axis
    MoveSliceAction
    Moves a slice to a new position along the slicing axis
    MultiSlicePositioner
    All specific methods and fields dedicated to the multislice positioner There is: - a positioning mode This is mostly useful at the beginning of the registration Slices can be moved along the axis / stretched and shrunk Only certain sections of the atlas are shown to improve global overview, based on the user need - a review mode This is mostly useful for reviewing the quality of registration Only one slice is visible at a time The atlas is fully displayed
    MultiSlicePositioner.SliceInfo
    Informations sent to the registration server (provided the user agrees)
    RasterDeformationAction
    Performs registration set in registration tab to a slice
    RasterSliceAction
    Performs registration set in registration tab to a slice
    RegisterSliceAction
    Performs registration set in registration tab to a slice
    ReslicedAtlas  
    SliceActionObserver  
    SliceSources
    Class which contains the current registered SourceAndConverter array Each element of the array is a channel This class should be UI independent (no show / bdvhandle, etc)
    SliceSources.RegistrationAndSources  
    SliceToImagePlus  
    SourcesZOffset  
    UnMirrorSliceAction
    Moves a slice to a new position along the slicing axis
